SEARCH
Package com.game.Characters.EnemyMovement

Class PathFinder

java.lang.Object
com.game.Characters.EnemyMovement.PathFinder
public class PathFinder extends Object
Provides functionality to find paths for enemies in a game environment.

The PathFinder class uses a grid-based approach to determine the shortest path for an enemy character from a starting point to a goal point considering obstacles and terrain costs. This class relies on a simplified A* (A-Star) pathfinding algorithm and is specifically tailored for use within a MainGamePanel context.

  • Constructor Details

    • PathFinder

  • Method Details

    • instantiateNode

      public void instantiateNode()
      Instantiates grid nodes based on the dimensions provided by the MainGamePanel.

      This method creates a grid of Node objects that represent possible positions in the game environment. Each node is initialized with its grid coordinates but without any pathfinding costs or state.

    • resetNodes

      public void resetNodes()
      Resets the pathfinding grid and state for a new pathfinding operation.

      All nodes are reset to their initial state, clearing any previous pathfinding data such as costs and parent nodes. Additionally, the open and path lists are cleared, and pathfinding state variables are reinitialized.

    • setNode

      public void setNode(int startCol, int startRow, int goalCol, int goalRow, Character character)
      Prepares the pathfinding grid with starting and goal nodes and updates node states.

      This method sets the starting and goal nodes based on provided coordinates and updates the grid to reflect obstacles and terrain costs by analyzing the game environment. It marks nodes as solid (impassable) if they correspond to obstacles in the game environment.

      Parameters:
      startCol - the column index of the start node
      startRow - the row index of the start node
      goalCol - the column index of the goal node
      goalRow - the row index of the goal node
      character - the Character for which the path is being found

    • getCost

      public void getCost(Node node)
      Calculates and updates the pathfinding costs for a given node.

      This method computes the G, H, and F costs of a node. The G cost represents the distance from the start node, and the H cost represents the heuristic estimated distance to the goal node. The F cost is the sum of G and H costs, used to determine the node's priority in pathfinding.

      Parameters:
      node - the Node for which costs are calculated

    • search

      public boolean search()
      Executes the pathfinding search to find the shortest path to the goal.

      This method iterates through available nodes, expanding paths and assessing costs to determine the most efficient route to the goal. It utilizes A* search algorithm principles, considering both the traveled distance and an estimate of the distance to the goal. The search terminates either when the goal is reached or a specified step limit is exceeded.

      Returns:
      true if a path to the goal was found, false otherwise

    • trackThePath

      public void trackThePath()
      Traces back the path from the goal node to the start node.

      After reaching the goal, this method retraces the steps taken to reach the goal node from the start node. The path is reconstructed by following the parent nodes from the goal to the start, effectively mapping the path taken.

    • openNode

      public void openNode(Node node)
      Marks a node as open if it is not already opened, checked, or solid.

      This method adds a node to the open list if it is traversable (not solid), has not been checked, and is not already in the open list. Each opened node's parent is set to the current node to track the path's progression.

      Parameters:
      node - the Node to be opened
